item.title: What's the “Patristic Text Archive?”
item.description: The “Patristic Text Archive” provides everyone interested with a collection of Late Antique Christian texts (i.e. “Patristic” is conceived in a very broad sense). The archive starts off with Greek texts, but it is open to all languages, in which texts from Late Antique Christianity are transmitted. The archive is furthermore a place for translations of Patristic texts in all modern languages. The archive starts off with only a few authors: First of all with Severian of Gabala1, i.

item.title: Contributing to the PTA
item.description: Contributions to the “Patristic Text Archive” are very welcome: If you like to contribute additional editions or translations in modern languages, please contact me. All contributions must have an open licence and have to be encoded according to the encoding regulations. As the PTA is work in progress, please file issues with the texts or translations here.
